maxSuggestions.description: How many suggestions should be shown when an auto-suggest menu pops up (including the "‚èé" option).
maxSuggestions.name: Maximum number of auto-suggestions to show

minLength.description: If higher than 0, auto-suggest will be triggered only when the beginning of any supported keywords is recognized.
minLength.name: Minimum match length for auto-suggest

toggle.description: Enabling this will open an intelligent suggest menu while typing inside a recognized task line.
toggle.name: Auto-suggest task content

settings.changeRequiresRestart: Changing any settings requires a restart of obsidian.

cancelledDate.description: Enabling this will add a timestamp ‚ùå YYYY-MM-DD at the end when a task is toggled to cancelled.
cancelledDate.name: Set cancelled date on every cancelled task

createdDate.description: Enabling this will add a timestamp ‚ûï YYYY-MM-DD before other date values, when a task is created with 'Create or edit task', or by completing a recurring task.
createdDate.name: Set created date on every added task

doneDate.description: Enabling this will add a timestamp ‚úÖ YYYY-MM-DD at the end when a task is toggled to done.
doneDate.name: Set done date on every completed task

description.line1: An additional date format that Tasks plugin will recogize when using the file name as the Scheduled date for undated tasks.

extraFormat.name: Additional filename date format as Scheduled date for undated tasks

folders.description: Leave empty if you want to use default Scheduled dates everywhere, or enter a comma-separated list of folders.
folders.name: Folders with default Scheduled dates

description.line2: If this option is enabled, any undated tasks will be given a default Scheduled date extracted from their file name.
description.line3: By default, Tasks plugin will match both YYYY-MM-DD and YYYYMMDD date formats.
description.line4: Undated tasks have none of Due (üìÖ ), Scheduled (‚è≥) and Start (üõ´) dates.

toggle.name: Use filename as Scheduled date for undated tasks

description.line1: The format that Tasks uses to read and write tasks.
description.line2: Important: Tasks currently only supports one format at a time. Selecting Dataview will currently stop Tasks reading its own emoji signifiers.

description.line1: Recommended: Leave empty if you want all checklist items in your vault to be tasks managed by this plugin.
description.line2: Use a global filter if you want Tasks to only act on a subset of your "- [ ]" checklist items, so that a checklist item must include the specified string in its description in order to be considered a task.
description.line3: For example, if you set the global filter to #task, the Tasks plugin will only handle checklist items tagged with #task.
description.line4: Other checklist items will remain normal checklist items and not appear in queries or get a done date set.

removeFilter.description: Enabling this removes the string that you set as global filter from the task description when displaying a task.
removeFilter.name: Remove global filter from description

query.description: A query that is automatically included at the start of every Tasks block in the vault. Useful for adding default filters, or layout options.
query.placeholder:
For example...
path does not include _templates/
limit 300
show urgency

nextLine.description: Enabling this will make the next recurrence of a task appear on the line below the completed task. Otherwise the next recurrence will appear before the completed one.
nextLine.name: Next recurrence appears on the line below
